explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 70degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2004), which is classified into Category 4. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#1547) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 615degC (ICSC, 2004)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#1547) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 444mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (dermal route) of 440mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 1, 2002), 440mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), 780mg/kg, 930mg/kg (EU-RAR No.50 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) of 442mg/kg (EU-RAR No.50 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LC50 value (4 hours) of 300ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation of vapor) of 1mg/L (4 hours) (EU-RAR No.50 (2004), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapor concentration (400ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.04kPa (20degC) (ICSC (2004)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the LC50 value (4 hours) of 2.3mg/L, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapor) of 5.1mg/L (4 hours) (CaPSAR (1994)), 3.3mg/L (4 hours) (EU-RAR No.50 (2004)), 3.19mg/L(4 hours) (EU-RAR No.50 (2004)), 1.82mg/L (4 hours) (EU-RAR No.50 (2004)) was higher than of the saturated vapor concentration (400ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.04kPa (25degC) (ICSC (2004)), the substance was considered as "mist".

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on the rabbit skin irritation test (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.63 (2004) and EU-RAR No.50 (2004)): "moderate irritant".

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on the rabbit eye irritation test (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.63 (2004) and EU-RAR No.50 (2004)): "severe irritant".

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on the testing data of guinea pig skin sensitization tests (EU-RAR No.50 (2004)) and data on human health effects (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.63 (2004), EU-RAR No.50 (2004)) - both positive.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), and the absence of data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.63 (2004) and EU-RAR No. 50 (2004).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category 3 by EU (2004), Category B2 by IRIS (2005) and Category A3 by ACGIH (2005).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the results of rat/mouse developmental toxicity studies: body weight reduction, an increase in the relative weight of the liver, effects on blood are observed in offspring at dose levels toxic to parent animals. (No data are available on reproductive toxicity.)

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (blood system, heart, liver, kidneys, respiratory organs, nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "dizziness, coma, contraction of the pupil, confusion, achromasia, cyanosis," and "formation of methemoglobin, myocardial/hepatic/renal degeneration, pulmonary/cerebral edema, bulbar hemorrhage" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.63 (2004)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (blood system, nervous system, respiratory organs)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "cyanosis, headache, dizziness, dysphagia, nausea, vomiting, chest/abdominal pain or convulsions, hyposthenia, palpitation, irregular respiration, contraction of the pupil (reactive to light), hypothermia, aniline odor in exhalation and perspiration, dark urine, pulmonary edema (in severe cases), acraturesis, encopresis" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.63 (2004)) and the evidence from animal studies including "enlargement/blackening of the spleen, extramedullary hematopoiesis, an increase in methemoglobin and Heinz bodies, reticulocytosis, enlargement of the spleen and liver, degradation of the spleen and kidneys, hemosiderin deposition in the adrenal and liver, an increase in mean cell volume, a decrease in red blood cell count, hemoglobin concentrations, hematocrit levels, mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentrations and erythroid bone marrow cells" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.63 (2004)). Severe effects on nervous systems and respiratory organs, due probably to methemoglobinemia, are observed. The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours LC50=80microg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 1, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 85% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.9 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
